title: Zlantann
author: Zlantann
content: Due to the belief that Bitcoin is a get quick rich scheme in some quarters, some Bitcoiners have been very skeptical to introduce it to some friends and colleagues. But many people believe that it holds a vast amount of power in the future of financial freedom. Recently  Jay-Z  and Twitter founder and Block CEO Jack Dorsey are partnering to fund a free Bitcoin educational program called  Bitcoin Academy  in Marcy Houses, Brooklyn. They believe that Bitcoin education is a vital tool to make sound financial decisions, build greater independence and gain financial empowerment.The courses will be offered both in-person and online from June to September. The Bitcoin Academy website states that the vision for Bitcoin is that it doesn’t have barriers, but lack of access to financial education is a barrier. It’s still hard to use for everyday necessities. Plus, people need devices and data plans. In order to eliminate some of these barriers residents can learn more about Bitcoin specifically and participant will receive free MiFi devices and a one-year limited data plan, plus smartphones if needed. The organizer says the program could be expanded to other neighborhoods in the  future .

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: Is a 'bitcoin academy' necessary? Why the clamor to teach bitcoin all of a sudden. If someone wants to learn about bitcoin, there are a plethora of materials on the internet to get started already, and if that person is curious enough, then they will find out about bitcointalk forum and register here, and the learning process continues, people who sincerely want to learn about bitcoin, always find out about this forum in one way or another.Bitcoin academy and its courses to me feels like pulling uninterested people to learn about bitcoin because of celebrities are in charge of it, and they sense they can gain something from it; everything to learn about bitcoin is on the internet, and from there you find bitcointalk.

comments.body: Quote from: Zlantann on June 09, 2022, 07:37:03 PMDue to the belief that Bitcoin is a get quick rich scheme in some quartersThose who believe it's a Get Rich Quick Scheme should relate their experiences with us, and they should be truthful in doing that. Many have been burnt for accepting this irrational belief.Quotesome Bitcoiners have been very skeptical to introduce it to some friends and colleagues.Well, skepticism would depend on the angle the person wants to introduce Bitcoin to his friends. When I came into this industry in 2017, I was all over the place talking to friends about Bitcoin even when I didn't know much about it. It was like singing a strange song to them. Most of them didn't get interested. Fast forward to the present, they want to get into it now. On this I will say, if you get to tell someone about Bitcoin and they don't show any interest; don't bother them. Just leave them, at their own time they will come around it.BTW, I like the fact that Jack isn't any more the CEO of Twitter at a time this is happening. Even at that, idiots are still going to fall prey if anyone dangles a free giveaway before them.
